abstract: The Australian mining company made an offer for the Potash Corporation on the assumption that the demand for potash would rise.
snippet: The Australian mining company made an offer for the Potash Corporation on the assumption that the demand for potash would rise.
lead_paragraph: The price of potash is all-important to BHP Billiton, the Australian mining company. BHP’s $39 billion hostile bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan is essentially a bet on demand for the commodity.

headline.print_headline: A $39 Billion Bid Is a Bet on Potash

byline.original: By Una Galani and Martin Hutchinson

abstract: Federal regulators have charged two Spanish investors with trading on secret information about BHP Billiton’s bid to acquire Potash Corp.
snippet: Federal regulators have charged two Spanish investors with trading on secret information about BHP Billiton’s bid to acquire Potash Corp.
lead_paragraph: Federal regulators have charged two Spanish investors with trading on secret information about BHP Billiton‘s bid to acquire Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: 2 Spaniards Charged for BHP-Potash Inside Trades

abstract: BHP Billiton’s hostile $39 billion bid for fertilizer group Potash Corp. faces a potential obstacle — formal approval by its own shareholders — if it sweetens its offer by more than 22 percent.
snippet: BHP Billiton’s hostile $39 billion bid for fertilizer group Potash Corp. faces a potential obstacle — formal approval by its own shareholders — if it sweetens its offer by more than 22 percent.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton‘s hostile $38.6 billion bid for fertilizer group Potash Corporation of Sasketchewan faces a potential obstacle — formal approval by its own shareholders — if it sweetens its offer by more than 22 percent, Reuters reported.

headline.main: BHP’s Sweetener May Be Restricted by British Rules

abstract: BHP Billiton, the mining company that has made a hostile takeover bid for Potash Corp. of Saskatchewan, said Wednesday that full-year profit more than doubled because of higher raw material prices.
snippet: BHP Billiton, the mining company that has made a hostile takeover bid for Potash Corp. of Saskatchewan, said Wednesday that full-year profit more than doubled because of higher raw material prices.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton, the mining company that has made a hostile takeover bid for Potash Corp. of Saskatchewan, said Wednesday that full-year profit more than doubled because of higher raw material prices, Julia Werdigier reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: BHP Billiton, Chasing Potash, Says Profit Soars

abstract: Marius Kloppers is using the mining company’s strong earnings to prove to his shareholders that his $39 billion bid for Potash is not too expensive.
snippet: Marius Kloppers is using the mining company’s strong earnings to prove to his shareholders that his $39 billion bid for Potash is not too expensive.
lead_paragraph: Marius Kloppers, the chief executive of BHP Billiton, has shown his shareholders that the world’s largest mining company is in good financial shape. Now he has to prove the same about BHP’s hostile offer for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, Julia Werdigier of The New York Times reports from London.

headline.main: BHP Chief on the Road to Defend Bid for Potash

abstract: Marius Kloppers expressed confidence regarding BHP’s hostile bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan.
snippet: Marius Kloppers expressed confidence regarding BHP’s hostile bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  Marius Kloppers, the chief executive of BHP Billiton, has made no secret of his passion for acquisitions.

headline.main: BHP Chief Not Anxious Over Potash Bid
headline.print_headline: BHP Chief Not Anxious Over Potash Bid
